title: Backtrace Not Captured Correctly for Application Names with Hyphens in Rails Console
body:
### Steps to reproduce
``` ruby
$ rails _7.2.1.2_ new hoge_app
$ cd hoge_app
$ rails c
Loading development environment (Rails 7.2.1.2)
hoge-app(dev)> SQLite3.status
/home/work/hoge_app/vendor/bundle/ruby/3.3.0/gems/irb-1.14.1/lib/irb.rb:1260:in `full_message': wrong number of arguments (given 0, expected 1..2) (ArgumentError)
```

### Expected behavior
``` ruby
hoge-app(dev)> SQLite3.status
(hoge-app):1:in `status': wrong number of arguments (given 0, expected 1..2) (ArgumentError) 
        from (hoge-app):1:in `<main>'
```

### Actual behavior
The output `vendor/bundle/ruby/3.3.0/gems/irb-1.14.1/lib/irb.rb:1260:in 'full_message'` is incorrect. It should output `(hoge-app):1:in 'status'` instead.
``` ruby
hoge-app(dev)> SQLite3.status
/home/work/hoge_app/vendor/bundle/ruby/3.3.0/gems/irb-1.14.1/lib/irb.rb:1260:in `full_message': wrong number of arguments (given 0, expected 1..2) (ArgumentError)
```

### System configuration
**Rails version**: 7.2.1.2
**Ruby version**: 3.3.5

### Additional information
#### Cause
I found that the following regular expression in [backtrace_cleaner.rb](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/main/railties/lib/rails/backtrace_cleaner.rb#L8) is likely causing the issue. The regular expression does not allow for application names with hyphens (e.g., "hoge-app").
``` ruby
APP_DIRS_PATTERN = /\A(?:\.\/)?(?:app|config|lib|test|\(\w*\))/
```

#### Cause of Occurrence
This issue appears to have started occurring with Rails 7.2 due to the changes introduced in the following PRs:

[PR #50825](https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/50825)
[PR #52616](https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/52616)


Is there any plan for a fix regarding this issue? I would appreciate your guidance.
